title: Pantheon mistake?
body:
The thing that i never understood about Pantheon is that he is clearly a Greek Hoplite Soldier (Spartigate), but his name is Pantheon which is a religious building from Ancient Rome not Greece, now the 'Parthenon' is an ancient Greek building, this would have been the correct name. Safe to say i think Riot needs to brush up on their ancient historyï»¿

What are your guys opinions on this?

replies.body: There is no Rome or Greece in League of Legends. Pantheon comes from Mount Targon.
I know, but they based his name and being from real life locations..

The definition of "pantheon" according to the Oxford Dictionary:
1. All the gods of a people or religion
1.1 (Especially in ancient **Greece** and Rome) a temple dedicated to all the gods
2. A group of famous or important people.
3. A building in which the illustrious dead of a nation are buried or honoured.

Know your sh!t before complaining.
I know my %%%%, the building Pantheon is from ancient Rome, Sparta is located in ancient Greece.

you just got schooled and you STILL argue?

its a REFERENCE. and a NAME. it doesnt have to BE exactly like the real world. especially since he has his own lore of where he comes from and what his name is....

its like saying my sons name, Zebulon, shouldnt be allowed because he isnt in the bible.
